intro: Pittosporum raivavaeense, commonly known as the Raivavae Pittosporum, is a rare endemic species native to the island of Raivavae in French Polynesia. It is a small evergreen tree or shrub characterized by its glossy, elliptical leaves and fragrant, white to pale yellow flowers. The plant produces small, round berries that are typically orange to red in color. It thrives in humid, tropical climates and is often found in coastal or lowland forest habitats. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
